pros: Diversity, inclusion,work from home, work life balance.
cons: Small co getting large quickly lots of change

review_title: Micromanaged nightmare. Welcome to call center hell.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Portland, OR
pros: No cost to commute work from home.
cons: Any customer service positions here are highly micromanaged and monitored. You don't learn this till the last day of training that they watch you remotely real time and listen to calls constantly. Insufficient training giving you cliff notes for the job. High call volumes from rude pushy 3rd party calls non stop. I literally had moments I couldn't even breathe between calls because you have 2 minutes to fully wrap up make notes about the call and get back into available mode when on one call you could be assisting a provider with up to 3 different issues meaning 3 different notes. Working from home they have your time micromanaged to the point that you get 6 minutes a day to use the bathroom or take a break outside break times. I had more freedom to use the bathroom working full time on site or take a breather as needed. Time away from being available on the phones dings your metrics. You become a score not a person. Stingy with time off requests even for doctor appointments. False expectations for the job given until end of training in which they consistently lose at least half of all the training groups upon disclosure of how things really work. The company boasts equity and for members they are great but for employees if you are in any entry level role it is a miserable experience.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Portland, OR
pros: Supportive for pregnant women and working families. Lots of Diversity and inclusivity. Care Oregon provides a lot of one on one time and coaching with Supervisors and Management.
cons: Wish they provided part time opportunities.

pros: Work from home with $100/mo reimbursement for office and wellness expenses. Very friendly + supportive team environment. Employer contributes $600 towards HSA. 1 paid volunteer day per year...
cons: Data organization is lacking, much of my time is spent rangling data from numerous excel documents instead of conveniently queried.

pros: Work from home has been a bonus, supportive team and manager
cons: I am pretty content | satisfied

pros: Flexible, values work life balance, people are responsive, seem engaged in their work
cons: Currently have been work from home due to pandemic. Most/some will go to hybrid and the messaging has been terrible on that. Would like better PTO benefits, specifically around short term disability/FMLA. You end up using up all your PTO would be nice to have different bucket of hours.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Portland, OR
pros: Dedicated coworkers, generous pto, Providing valuable services to its customers.
cons: New management at the customer service department required unreasonable, ineffective performance standards. Reviews were a blur of speadsheets.

review_title: Mostly ineffective - work here if you would like to do little.
pros: Could, theoretically help a large population of people in the metro region.
cons: Probably won't get much done; completing projects is not the goal; passing audits with pitch decks about what we "might" do, is the primary goal.

job_title: Director Clinical Integration in Portland, OR
pros: Flexible culture and passionate employees who love the mission
cons: Very large, sometimes hard to get things done

pros: Great people. great mission. Benefits are good, and work/life balance is encouraged.
cons: Leadership is wandering and indecisive. Company has no strategic direction and goes wherever the wind blows. C-Suite is riding on good luck and the fact that OHA can't find their butt with both hands.

pros:
WFH. 
Good work life balance.
cons:
Below average pay for industry
Management is out of touch with those who do the job and feedback is usually ignored.

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Portland, OR
pros: Salary and benefits are fair.
cons: There is no flexibility for employees.

pros: Good mission, work at home options, good benefits and compensation.
cons: Not flexible with time off needs. Not employee centric. Tools and resources are not the best options, out of date, or not maintained.

review_title: Great place to work. Great people!!
pros: Great work culture. Humble and down to Earth. They care and do work that helps the community and those in difficult times.
cons: Could pay a little better, but worth it to work with good people. Downtown is expensive to park.

pros: Great team, flexible hours, smart co-workers
cons: Systems issues and limited resources

review_title: Good company but becoming more corporate
job_title: Health Equity Specialist in Portland, OR
pros: Excellent flexibility, great staff, good PTO starting at accumulating 20 days per year, decent pay depending on your department and role.
cons: Non-equal benefits and culture depending on your department, favoritism at play when it comes to promotions, very top-down, and bureaucratic.

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist in Portland, OR
pros: Awesome people who work here
cons: Mandates vaccine and doesn't give tests options

pros: Nice employer, job security, work from home, flexible
cons: No ability to grow, non competitive pay

job_title: Health Care Coordinator in Portland, OR
pros: Very mission driven organization that takes great care of their employees. Overall the benefits (especially PTO and 401K) are very generous. Care Oregon is quite flexible with remote working, especially during Covid. This is a very progressive workplace, and the work you do is impactful.
cons: Like any large organization, sometimes things can get bogged down in bureaucracy- an example is the timeline to transfer jobs internally can take much longer than needed. The cost share for employee/family medical-dental-vision coverages can be quite high. The pay is pretty good, so perhaps that may help mitigate the insurance costs? All in all, CO is a great place to have a career!

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Portland, OR
pros: Work from home, decent benefits
cons: A lot of work as a CSR

pros: Flexible, fair pay, amazing 401k match
cons: Health insurance is pricy and limited remote options

pros: Flexibility on schedule and time management
cons: Poor leadership. Middle management in fighting, task micromanagement

pros: Remote work, flexible hours, competitive salary
cons: Can be hard to advance without switching departments

pros: Great people, great mission, collaborative environment
cons: Doesn’t always reward top performers

pros: Weekly newsletter to update everyone on departments, highlighting new employees, etc., great leadership, mission.
cons: Not all departments have room for growth.

job_title: Legal & Regulatory Coordinator in Portland, OR
pros: For the most part, supports work/life balance. Good benefits.
cons: Pay isn't necessarily market value but it is a non-profit.

review_title: Overall Functional, a Few Career Micromanagers
pros: Decent pay, good benefits. Many departments are well-managed. Upper management is somewhat accessible to the common worker. Interesting committee work available to those who are willing to seek it out and show up.
cons: Management of this particular department maintained staff in a siloed condition. Lead worker of 8 years did not understand basic daily standards and regs of the job, and peer staff turnover was very high. No opportunity for training or professional development or contact with external peers offered to certain specialized staff. Micromanaged daily work was difficult to deal with, as the poor work of one employee resulted in micromanagement for all.  Unqualified or underqualified staffers at competitive pay were allowed to work to lower basic performance and production standards than more-qualified and productive staff. Technology very behind the times. Company focus on being "special" resulted in the purchase of an IT enterprise solution product that was poorly-crafted for the company's needs, which impacted staff ability to work for years. Key departments left behind on outdated, poorly functioning systems. Had I had the vision to take a pay cut and move laterally to get out of the very poorly managed unit I was in, I am certain I would still be a very happy camper at CareOregon. Many well-managed departments to choose from. Just not the one I was in, which has continued to have that reputation amongst workers and contractors in different departments across the org.

pros: Flexible hours and working environment, really cares about employees.
cons: I can't think of any cons.

job_title: Behavior Health Specialist in Portland, OR
pros: Great pay, great leadership, and flexible work style, remote work available
cons: N/A no cons, great company

pros: This is a company that cares about the members that it serves, is innovative in its solutions while conscious of the rising cost of healthcare.
cons: Work experience varies by manager of department.  One department had an incredible manager who led with vision and inspiration while the current manager is incompetent,insecure and micromanages.  There is little opportunity for advancement and preferential treatment for few. Jobs have been created for some individuals while opportunities to develop skills and advance are denied to most others.  Outside hires are preferred to promotion from within by those who actually have done the work and  developed the systems to do so.

pros: Love coming to work every day! Excellent pay. Non-profit. Great co-workers, positive environment in most departments. Company is very employee-oriented. They take action based on employee feedback and the feedback is transparent. Much discussion of company visions, intentions and financials are given out freely in meetings. Everything is transparent, I just love how open the company is to any questions. There are no secrets. Open positions are posted, and encouragement given to apply. Innovation is exalted. Gosh, I can go on, this is such a great company!
cons: Building is kept too hot! Often times floors are kept between 75-85 degrees even in the summer. Hard to work in those conditions. Some departments lack uplifting management - and are very clique-ish. Some supervisors/managers should not be supervisors and lack people/management skills (NOT my department).

job_title: Senior Sales Manager in Portland, OR
pros:
CareOregon is truly a mission driving organization that cares about both its employees and its members.
The benefits are great.
The people are very nice.
cons:
As it's a smaller organization, the higher you are in "rank" the less opportunity there is for advancement.
There are quite a few politics for a small organization.
You REALLY need to be prepared to take on multiple roles as they under hire in order to make sure they don't need to lay people off.

pros: CareOregon evolves. While most health organizations stay with the status quo, CareOregon takes risks and adjusts to the changing times. We not only provide health care, but care for the whole person, taking into account the social determinants of health. CareOregon not only talks the talk, but walks the walk as well. In nine years off working here, I have yet to encounter someone I couldn't work with or through.
cons: I would say the only take away is that we've grown so much that we're outgrowing our building! It can make for some crowded floors, but with the capability to be flexible and let people work remotely, it cancels out.

review_title: Good overall place to work w/great bennies
job_title: Office Support Specialist in Portland, OR
pros: Great benefits, lots of vacation time, extra perks like tri-met, etc, pretty nice people to work with, HR tries to find good balance between organization economics and staff needs, good recognition of work/life balance. great accessible downtown location.
cons: management can be a little touchy feely sometimes, you may be forced to play cheesy games, etc.  Still, a good overall experience with more pros than cons.

review_title: One of the best decisions I made in my life was to decide to work with CareOregon
job_title: Prior Authorization Assistant in Portland, OR
pros: Flexible schedule, good pay, room to grow, constant opportunity to learn and build experience, opportunities to work from home.
cons: As an outside applicant, it's very competitive, and hard to get hired. With the huge growth that CareOregon has experienced, it does not have the same small company feel it did when I first started.

review_title: Good Company that most can ell right at home with.

pros: Healthy work environment.  Friendly Co workers. Convenient Location right off the Max line.
cons: Often too much down time. Micromanaging from certain managers. Clear difference of treatment between hourly and salary positions. Not fast enough upward growth.

review_title: Amazing company passionate about it's members and employees

cons: Not enough support for employees who work remotely, poor choice in company who provides physical exams for pre employment testing.

review_title: Overly positive with a few bumps

review_title: Company true to their mission, going through some growing pains

pros: CareOregon’s staff are incredibly collaborative. The goal is well-being--a happy, healthy engaging life--not just for members, but staff, too.
cons: Can always use more help.

pros: Excellent benefits, good comp, great time off.  Good work life balance, depending on which department you work within.

pros: Supportive atmosphere! Culture and work/life balance are top-notch.
